baseline_groups.claim_summary: Higher corporate tax rates reduce foreign sales ratios (sales shifting to low-tax jurisdictions)
baseline_groups.notes: Coef=-0.0054, p<0.001. Panel FE (country+industry+year). 96.6% of specs show negative coefficient.

global_notes: Panel study of US multinational affiliates 1999-2013. Uses simulated data (original BEA data restricted). 64 specs. Very robust negative relationship between tax rates and foreign sales ratios. Alternative treatments (tax haven dummy, low tax thresholds) show expected positive signs.
